net.myorb.math.computational

Class FunctionRoots<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.myorb.math.SignManager
      • net.myorb.math.ComputationConfiguration<T>
        • net.myorb.math.Arithmetic<T>
          • net.myorb.math.ListOperations<T>
            • net.myorb.math.Tolerances<T>
              • net.myorb.math.computational.FunctionRoots<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - type of component values on which operations are to be executed
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    SignManagementOperations
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FunctionRootsTest

    public class FunctionRoots<T>
extends Tolerances<T>
    algorithms for computations of roots of functions
    Author:
    Michael Druckman

      • checkSign

        public boolean checkSign(net.myorb.data.abstractions.Function<T> f,
                         T from,
                         T to)
                  throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Parameters:
        f - the function seeking root
        from - the lo end of interval containing the root
        to - the hi end of interval containing the root
        Returns:
        TRUE : lo is negative and hi is positive
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - for initial conditions

      • iterate

        public T iterate(net.myorb.data.abstractions.Function<T> function,
                 net.myorb.math.computational.FunctionRoots.Iterator<T> iterator,
                 Arithmetic.Value<T> lo,
                 Arithmetic.Value<T> hi,
                 boolean loNeg)
          throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Parameters:
        function - the function seeking root
        iterator - formula to iteratively apply
        lo - the lo end of interval containing root
        hi - the hi end of interval containing the root
        loNeg - TRUE : lo is negative and hi is positive
        Returns:
        the value found within threshold proximity to root
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - for failed convergence

                         T to)

        Parameters:
        f - the function being evaluated
        from - low end of range on x axis to look for root
        to - high end of range on x axis to look for root
        Returns:
        the value of the root found

      • newtonRaphsonMethod

        public T newtonRaphsonMethod(net.myorb.data.abstractions.Function<T> f,
                             net.myorb.data.abstractions.Function<T> derivative,
                             T x)
                      throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        use Newton's method to determine function root
        Parameters:
        f - the function being evaluated seeking roots
        derivative - the first derivative of the function to be evaluated
        x - the value of X to use for the evaluation, best approximation of root
        Returns:
        the value of the root found upon convergence indication
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - Failure to converge

      • newtonSecondOrderMethod

        public T newtonSecondOrderMethod(net.myorb.data.abstractions.Function<T> f,
                                 net.myorb.data.abstractions.Function<T> derivative,
                                 net.myorb.data.abstractions.Function<T> secondDerivative,
                                 T x)
                          throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        use second order of Newton's method
        Parameters:
        f - the function being evaluated for roots
        derivative - the first derivative of the function to be evaluated
        secondDerivative - the second derivative of the function to be evaluated
        x - the value of X to use for the evaluation, best approximation of root
        Returns:
        the value of the root found upon convergence indication
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - Failure to converge

      • newtonMethodApproximated

        public T newtonMethodApproximated(net.myorb.data.abstractions.Function<T> f,
                                  T x,
                                  T delta)
                           throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        use approximations of derivatives
        Parameters:
        f - the function seeking root
        x - the approximation of the root
        delta - the delta value to use for derivative approximations
        Returns:
        an approximation of the root from iterations applied
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - for too-small a derivative value

        Returns:
